thread.title: Marquis Who's Who Honors Bich "Vincent" Le, MD, for Expertise in Health Care
thread.title_full: Marquis Who's Who Honors Bich "Vincent" Le, MD, for Expertise in Health Care

title: Marquis Who's Who Honors Bich "Vincent" Le, MD, for Expertise in Health Care
text:
June 12, 2025
WESTMINSTER, CA, June 12, 2025 /24-7PressRelease/ -- Bich "Vincent" Le, MD, has been selected for inclusion in Marquis Who's Who. As in all Marquis Who's Who biographical volumes, individuals profiled are selected on the basis of current reference value. Factors such as position, noteworthy accomplishments, visibility, and prominence in a field are all taken into account during the selection process.
Dr. Le, a distinguished physician with over four decades of experience, has significantly contributed to obstetrics and gynecology. Since 1982, he has been dedicated to patient care and medical research. His work spans Vietnam and the U.S., where he collaborates on stem cell research and development. Dr. Le's innovative approach includes performing fresh cell therapy in collaboration with professionals in Bangkok to aid individuals with diabetes. His commitment to advancing medical science is further evidenced by his successful treatment of patients with advanced cervical cancer.
In addition to his medical practice, Dr. Le has expanded his expertise into cosmetic surgery over the past decade. He performs procedures such as Botox, anti-aging treatments and rejuvenation therapies. Dr. Le's career also includes roles as an educator at the University of California Irvine and a medical school in Vietnam. His proficiency in over a dozen languages, including Vietnamese, Chinese and French, has been instrumental in his ability to connect with diverse groups.
In preparation for his career, Dr. Le obtained a bachelor's degree in science and chemistry, magna cum laude, from the University of San Francisco and a Doctor of Medicine, with honors, from the University of California San Francisco in 1982. His academic achievements were notably supported by scholarships, including the Chemical Engineering Scholarship from UC Berkeley and the Hillel Scholarship from the Hillel Foundation.
Active in his professional community, Dr. Le is a member of the American Chemical Society, the American College of Chemistry, the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists and the American College of Physicians. He is also actively involved in civic-minded organizations, such as Doctors Without Borders, and provides free medical care through initiatives at Catholic churches in Vietnam and Cambodia and free clinics in the U.S. These efforts reflect Dr. Le's commitment to giving back to those in need.
Throughout his career, Dr. Le has been recognized for his excellence and dedication. Notably, he discovered medications that can halt the production of the COVID-19 virus and assists friends with dental reconstructive surgery using stem cells. He also received numerous accolades, including being named Physician of the Year by President George W. Bush and Top Doctor in Orange County for five consecutive years.
Dr. Le was born and raised in Saigon, South Vietnam. He can speak a dozen languages and is fluent in professional English, French, Spanish, Thai, Chinese and Vietnamese. He was listed in Who's Who in American Colleges and Universities.
As he prepares for future advancements, Dr. Le is eager to continue his work on stem cells by focusing on studying their potential applications in implantation and bone grafts. Inspired by his mother's wisdom that success is not just about achievements but also about striving for future goals, Dr. Le remains dedicated to leaving a legacy through his contributions to medicine and society.
About Marquis Who's Who®:
Since 1899, when A. N. Marquis printed the First Edition of Who's Who in America®, Marquis Who's Who® has chronicled the lives of the most accomplished individuals and innovators from every significant field of endeavor, including politics, business, medicine, law, education, art, religion and entertainment. Who's Who in America® remains an essential biographical source for thousands of researchers, journalists, librarians and executive search firms around the world. The suite of Marquis® publications can be viewed at the official Marquis Who's Who® website, www.marquiswhoswho.com.
